intro: Vangueriopsis rufa, commonly known as the red-flowered vangueriopsis, is a member of the Fabaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Vangueriopsis rufa is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
